Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the rate of fire of the rifle used by Omar Mateen, stating that it can shoot off 700 rounds in a minute.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that if Mateen had a different type of weapon, such as a glock pistol, the death toll would have been lower.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the statement that the rifle used by Mateen can shoot off 700 rounds in a minute.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the rifle used by Mateen may not have been capable of firing 700 rounds per minute without serious alterations.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that both the AR-15 and Sig Sauer MCX rifles are sold for civilian use as semi-automatic rifles, not fully automatic weapons.
Understate: The claim understates the difficulty of firing 700 rounds per minute due to the time it would take to reload magazines and the risk of the gun overheating.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by providing conflicting information about the specific type of rifle used by Mateen.
